trans-unit.source: Provides methods to convert a WS-Federation message to <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> and <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> objects, which are WS-Trust protocol specific.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationSerializer"></xref> class.

The new instance serializes WS-Federation messages into WS-Trust Feb 2005 protocol messages; an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustFeb2005RequestSerializer> class is used to serialize requests and an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustFeb2005ResponseSerializer> class is used to serialize responses.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationSerializer"></xref> class based on the namespace of the response XML.
The request and response messages are serialized based on the namespace of the response XML (the appropriate WS-Trust serializers are used based on the namespace).
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> opened on the response XML.
reader is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationSerializer"></xref> class with the specified request and response serializers.
The WS-Trust Serializer to use to read the request (RST).
The WS-Trust Serializer to use to write the response (RSTR).
requestSerializer is `null`.
-or-
responseSerializer is `null`.

Checks whether the specified string is a wst:RequestSecurityToken message with a namespace that is recognized by the wrapped <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer"></xref>.
The WS-Trust message to check.

`true` if the message is a valid wst:RequestSecurityToken message with a namespace that matches the WS-Trust protocol that this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationSerializer"></xref> supports; otherwise, `false`.

Checks whether the specified string is a wst:RequestSecurityTokenResponse message with a namespace that is recognized by the wrapped <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer"></xref>.
The WS-Trust message to check.

`true` if the message is a valid wst:RequestSecurityTokenResponse message with a namespace that matches the WS-Trust protocol that this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationSerializer"></xref> supports; otherwise `false`.

Converts a WS-Federation Sign-In Request message to a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object that the security token service (the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityTokenService"></xref> class) can consume.
The message to convert.
This should be an instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInRequestMessage"></xref>.
The current serialization context.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object that represents the converted Sign-In Request message.
message is null.
-or-
context is `null`.
The message is not of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInRequestMessage"></xref>.
-or-

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInRequestMessage"></xref> object is missing required information to construct a valid <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
Converts a WS-Federation Sign-In Response message object to a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object.
The message to convert.
This should be an instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage"></xref>.
The current serialization context.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object that represents the converted Sign-In Response message.
message is `null`.
-or-
context is `null`.
The message is not of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage"></xref>.
-or-

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage"></xref> object is missing required information to construct a valid <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object.
Gets the wreq string from a referenced URL.
Override this method to get the wreq string from a reference URL.
The default implementation throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
The URL of the request data.
The request data from the URL.
Thrown by the default implementation.
Gets the wresult string from a referenced URL.
Override this method to get the wresult string from a reference URL.
The default implementation throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
The URL of the result data.
The request data from the URL.
Thrown by the default implementation.
Serializes the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object into a string.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object to serialize.
The current serialization context.
A serialized string representation of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
request is `null`.
-or-
context is `null`.
Serializes the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object into a string.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object to serialize.
The current serialization context.
A serialized string representation of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object.
response is `null`.
-or-
context is `null`.
